topics.body:
Here's a bit of kind of mean of me to say, but kind of good news on the same token.  It's kind of mean for me to say this, but it's kind of a good thing:  Congress for the usa is getting old man.

What I mean by this is that the last two decades we've been seeing longer and longer incumbents who continue to stay in office; this has lead for the average age of people in congress to be around the 60 year old mark.

In say ten years the majority of congress is probably going to wind up being forced to retire and we're going to see new people coming in.

Don't like the current congress?  Then in say ten years the majority of them are going to have to retire.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535ee60863687210a7a30100#post_535ee60863687210a7a30100
Nah, special interest groups are kind of dumb when it comes to efficiently working the system.

They have effective control of congress cause their tactics politically is throw enough money.  Sure that works right now cause only under a dozen or so congressmen get replaced every election on average(Sorry republicans/democrats if you think you're getting a super majority in 2014 you're a idiot), but if you have to replace the vast majority of congress with plants in a short time you're not going to be as effective.

Sure there's going to be plenty of corrupt congressmen in two decades, but not nearly as many as we have because the current tactics only work cause congress right now has such a low turnaround.  If you're a lobbyist group then you better get your checkbook extremely ready cause you're going to need it badly soon.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
